programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: No. 3 seed Atlanta Drive GC (4-1-0) comes into the playoffs after cruising past Jupiter Links GC, 9-1, on March 4; No. 2 seed The Bay Golf Club (4-1-0) won the first encounter during the regular season with a 6-5 triumph on Feb. 17.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Utah is coming off a 3-1 win over Vancouver and is 17-13-4 on the road this season; Edmonton is 20-11-2 at home and won its first two meetings with Utah this season, including a 4-1 victory at Rogers Place on Dec. 31 as Connor Brown had two assists.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Utah is coming off a 3-1 win over Vancouver and is 17-13-4 on the road this season; Edmonton is 20-11-2 at home and won its first two meetings with Utah this season, including a 4-1 victory at Rogers Place on Dec. 31 as Connor Brown had two assists.

programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Detroit beat Miami in their last two consecutive meetings, winning the most recent matchup on Dec. 16, 125-124, after overtime; Houston's Malik Beasley posted 28 points in the win while Cade Cunningham added a 20-point, 18-assist triple-double.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Florida Atlantic (18-15) is in the postseason for the fourth-straight year, and was 8-5 at home this season; Dayton (22-10) makes its fourth NIT appearance in the last eight seasons, and won the only previous meeting with the Owls, 81-56, in 2012.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Wichita State (19-14) makes its 14th NIT appearance in program history and the first since 2019; Oklahoma State (15-17) has advanced to the quarterfinals in its last two NIT appearances, and is 32-11 against the Shockers, last meeting in 2022.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Cal State Northridge (22-10) is making its first NIT appearance in program history; Stanford (20-13) plays in its first postseason since 2018 behind Maxime Raynaud, who led the ACC in rebounding with 10.6 rpg and was second in scoring with 20.1 ppg.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Jacksonville State (22-12) makes its first NIT appearance in program history behind Jaron Pierre Jr., who led the Conference USA in scoring with 21.5 ppg; Georgia Tech (17-16) plays in the postseason for the first time in four years.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Washington (19-13) makes its first tournament appearance since 2017 in its first season as a Big Ten member; Columbia (23-6) earned its second-straight at-large berth, the only two times the Lions have played in the NCAA Tournament.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Loyola Chicago (22-11) makes its third postseason appearance in the first four seasons under head coach Drew Valentine; San Jose State (15-19) earned its first NIT berth since 1981, and is hosting a postseason game for the first time.

programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Northern Iowa (20-12) makes its 20th trip to the postseason and first since the 2022 NIT; SMU (23-10) makes its seventh postseason in the last 11 possible years in its first year under head coach Andy Enfield and the first season as an ACC member.

programme.title: The Mina Kimes Show featuring Lenny
programme.desc: Mina Kimes brings her vast NFL knowledge and unique insight to the top stories making headlines across the league, breaking down the impact of the news, and is joined by guests to gather a different perspective on all things football.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: William & Mary (17-15) makes its first tournament appearance in program history after winning the CAA Tournament behind Bella Nascimento; High Point (21-11) earned its first berth since 2021 after winning the Big South Tournament.

programme.title: NCAA Championship In the Studio
programme.desc: Analyst and SportsCenter anchor Elle Duncan is joined by experts Rebecca Lobo and Andraya Carter as they discuss the upcoming action in the 2024 Women's NCAA Tournament with breakdowns of matchups and keys to the game with highlights and analysis.

programme.title: NCAA Championship In the Studio
programme.desc: Analyst and SportsCenter anchor Elle Duncan is joined by experts Rebecca Lobo and Andraya Carter as they discuss the upcoming action in the 2024 Women's NCAA Tournament with breakdowns of matchups and keys to the game with highlights and analysis.

programme.title: Formula 1 Practice
programme.desc: Formula 1 drivers learn the intricacies of the track and communicate to the crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race in China; crews work to set up car.

programme.title: All Access: ACC Life
programme.desc: Cameras give a unique glimpse of a day in the life of ACC student-athletes, coaches and staff, showing how the players spend time off the field and the challenges that come with managing their time each day between athletics and academics.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: The premier open-wheel racing organization, Formula 1 originated in 1950 as the top drivers traveled around the world to compete for the series championship, gaining points at each stop based upon their finish in the fast-paced races.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: The top 10 European fighters in UFC history are examined and profiled, showcasing how these hard-hitting brawlers carved their names into the annals of legend; highlights share how these battle-hardened combatants cemented their legacies.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: An in-depth newsmagazine featuring a talented pool of reporters and producers from ESPN, presenting profiles of well-known athletes and coaches as well as investigative reports and cutting-edge stories on emerging and established sports.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1983, North Carolina State suffered 10 losses in the regular season and had to overcome national powerhouses to win the ACC Tournament and qualify for the NCAA Tournament, where the Wolfpack mounted a memorable run to the national championship.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: A maximum field of 296 of the world's top bowlers compete for an $86,000 purse with the winner taking home $20,000 and the runner-up receiving $13,500; EJ Tackett of Blufton, Ind. enters the competition atop the PBA World Championship standings.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Walk-Off Stories
programme.desc: National League MVP Kirk Gibson, who was hobbled by leg injuries in the NLCS, was used as a pinch-hitter in Game 1 of the 1988 World Series, his only at-bat of the series, and would provide one of the most memorable home runs in MLB history.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Yoshinobu Yamamoto is expected to start for the Dodgers after pitching 90 innings last season and finishing with a 7-2 record and an ERA of 3.00; Shota Imanaga pitches for the Cubs and was 15-3 with a 2.91 ERA last season.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Yoshinobu Yamamoto is expected to start for the Dodgers after pitching 90 innings last season and finishing with a 7-2 record and an ERA of 3.00; Shota Imanaga pitches for the Cubs and was 15-3 with a 2.91 ERA last season.

programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.
